title: Album Page, "Vieille Maison, Lisieux", June 12, 1889
medium: Graphite on cream wove paper on secondary paperboard support with painted gold surface tipped into binding with fabric
signed: Recto, inscribed in graphite, lower right of inscriptions: Whitney Warren.
inscribed:
Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 74; bottom right corner: 61; to right of drawing: Note - water sheds and large dormer / of tile, not slate -; below drawing: Vieille Maison / Lisieux / 12 Juin 1889 - / Whitney Warren; at bottom center: Pour le cour de Monsieur Julien. 

Verso, in graphite: board is divided vertically into three sections by repeated graphite lines.  In center section at top: original sketches / Whitney Warren / O R I G I.. (written faintly on a ruled line).
dimensions: 30.9 x 23.6 cm (12 3/16 x 9 5/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.5 x 24.1 cm (12 3/8 x 9 1/2 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet depicting an elevation of a large building set into a hill that is seen from the corner.  The street level has signage for small shops that are contained within.  This is also the smallest of the three stories, as each subsquent level above hangs over the one below.  The street level seems to be of masonry with many windows, while the upper stories are half-timber and plastered.  At the first and second stories the eaves create a deep overhang and are visibly supported from underneath by large shaped brackets.  The building has a slate or tile roof, and a picturesque roofline with many dormers, gables, and chimneys.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Vieille Maison, Lisieux", June 12, 1889.Graphite on cream wove paper on secondary paperboard support with painted gold surface tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-234.
